Name: Hydraulic Elevator – Applies to most California Installations prior to 1976, most western states installations prior to 1982 and most U.S installations prior to 1998.

GeneralInformation.Description: Costing per elevator.  Elevator demand parameter shall be defined as the peak floor acceleration at the first floor.  The elevator fragility for a multiple story building should only be entered once on the first floor.
GeneralInformation.Author: Not Given

DamageStates.RepairMeasures: Multiple repairs possible (% change of each):  Repair damaged controls (100%)

DamageStates.Description: Damaged vane and hoist-way switches, and or bent cab stabilizers, and or damaged car guide shoes.
DamageStates.RepairMeasures: Multiple repairs possible (% change of each):  Repair damaged vane and hoist-way switches (41%), and or repair bent cab stabilizers (41%), and or repair damaged car guide shoes (41%).

DamageStates.Description: Damaged entrance and car door, and or flooring damage.
DamageStates.RepairMeasures: Multiple repairs possible (% change of each):  Repair damage to cab door (68%), and or repair cab flooring (46%)

DamageStates.Description: Oil leak in hydraulic line, and or hydraulic tank failure.
DamageStates.RepairMeasures: Multiple repairs possible (% change of each):  Repair oil leak in hydraulic line (27%), and or hydraulic tank failure (81%)
